page.title: 14CRIME/SCHOOLS/PARISHES
page.content: {CRIME}:-There is not much crime. Chain-saws and tractor batteries are sometimes stolen from farms. Security on farms is poor because you cannot lock up everything. Suicide is very rare but it was quite common when people would throw themselves down wells. {SCHOOLS}:-There are only two schools; Cumnor House for ages 4-13 and Danehill primary school for ages 5-11. Danehill children are in the catchment area of Chailey comprehensive. {PARISHES}:-Danehill, Fletching and Nutley are the three parishes in the area. Danehill occupies the major part of the square, Fletching and Nutley occupying the bottom and top right corners respectively.
